meanings.definition: To hear more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outhear her brother during their games.
meanings.sent2: I can outhear the birds chirping outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outhear the dog's barking by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outhear the noise of the city made her focus intently.
meanings.sent5: The child's ability to outhear his classmates in class amazed the teacher.

meanings.definition: To listen to something more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He would outhear the music playing in the distance.
meanings.sent2: I could outhear the sound of the waves crashing on the shore.
meanings.sent3: The students tried to outhear the teacher's instructions, but they were too busy chatting.
meanings.sent4: She would outhear the whispers of the wind as she walked through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The detective's ability to outhear the suspect's alibi led to a breakthrough in the case.
